Jason Roberson
==============

![J. Roberson 2 min](https://www.forneytx.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentID=8697 "J. Roberson 2 min")

Forney City Council, Mayor
--------------------------

[Email Jason Roberson](mailto: jroberson@forneytx.gov)  
Term Expires: 2025

Jason Roberson was elected as Mayor in 2023.

Goals
-----

I want to continue building Forney's infrastructure, as it is one of the top five fastest-growing cities in Texas. Â I plan to continue striving for an ethical environment within the city, encouraging transparency and supporting first responders. With this focus, I believe our city and the surrounding region can be the premier destination spot for families to grow and prosper.

Background
----------

In May 2023, I was elected Mayor with 70% of votes cast. I was first elected to the Forney City Council in May 2021 as Council Member Place 6. Â  During that time, we were proactive on many fronts, including making a push for the cityâ€™s first forensic audit, coordinating a comprehensive plan for the cityâ€™s retail and housing future, and making the American Rescue Plan Act funds available to small businesses and residents in need.

Â Outside of public service, my professional background is in communications â€” as a journalist, public relations executive, and ghostwriter of non-fiction books. Being an attentive listener and willing learner are the common threads between my public service and professional roles.

Â I married Takisha Roberson, my college sweetheart, in April 2002. Weâ€™ve been blessed with two teenagers who both are enrolled in Forney I.S.D.

Winter Storm Warning

Forney is under a winter storm warning from 6 p.m. Friday to noon CST Sunday. Ice, sleet, and snow are likely to begin on Friday evening and continue through Sunday morning. Current forecasts for the DFW area call for 2â€“4 inches of sleet and snow, along with up to Â½ inch of ice. TxDOT crews are pretreating interstates ahead of the storm. Forney Public Works crews are also prepared to treat city roads and priority intersections as conditions warrant.

TxDOT crews are pretreating interstates ahead of the storm. Forney Public Works crews are also prepared to treat city roads and priority intersections as conditions warrant.

**How to Prepare:**

* Protect people, pets, pipes, and plants
* Allow indoor faucets to drip and open cabinet doors
* Cover exterior pipes and faucets
* Charge phones and battery packs

**Stay Informed:**

ðŸ“² Sign up for emergency alerts: <https://www.forneytx.gov/480/Emergency-Notification>

âš¡ Know your electric provider (the City does not control electric service):

â€¢ Oncor outages: <https://stormcenter.oncor.com/>

â€¢ TVEC outages: <https://www.tvec.net/reporting-power-outages/>

ðŸš° Save the Cityâ€™s after-hours and non-emergency line: 972-552-6625

**What Not to Do:**

* Travel on icy roads unless necessary
* Leave pets outside in extreme cold
* Never run generators, grills, or propane heaters indoors or in garages

More information: <https://www.forneytx.gov/1046/Preparing-for-Cold-Weather-Information-a>
